content:
That's fantastic! Volunteering on a regular basis can be an incredibly rewarding experience, and it's great that you're considering taking the next step.

Absolutely, you should definitely reach out to Sarah or other staff members to discuss your interest in volunteering on a regular basis. They would likely be thrilled to have you on board and can provide more information about the different volunteer opportunities available.

You could start by sending an email or making a phone call to the shelter to express your interest in volunteering regularly. You could say something like:

"Hi Sarah, I wanted to follow up on my experience volunteering at the fundraising gala earlier this month. I had a great time and was really inspired by the work that the shelter is doing. I was wondering if there might be opportunities for me to volunteer on a more regular basis, perhaps weekly or bi-weekly. I'd love to discuss this further and see how I can get involved."

From there, you can discuss the different options with Sarah or other staff members, such as helping with animal care, assisting with adoptions, or supporting administrative tasks. They can also provide more information about the volunteer application process, any necessary training, and what to expect as a regular volunteer.

Remember to be flexible and open-minded about the opportunities that are available. Every shelter is different, and there may be specific needs or areas where they could use extra help.

Good luck, and I hope it works out!
